Tadaaaaaa! I've finally made the feature request for a new content type in Backdrop: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4903. Would be happy to get feedback over there.

Add a block content type 路 Issue #4903 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need With 'existing content' blocks and 'hidden-path' content, Backdrop provides a powerful alternative to custom blocks: fieldable, translatable as any other con...
New title for the request: "Add a 'hidden-path' content type for content blocks"

Personally, I would love to see a generic "type" that can have an alias path field added to it. When I brought this up, I was told there is too much old code that would cause major rewrites to have to happen so it was pretty much a hard no.

But anywho, I do like the approach Drupal took with converting blocks to entities which allows fieldable blocks. I think Backdrop makes it a LOT easier to handle fieldable content with layouts though so a content type could always be used for this proposed purpose. I guess I'm good either way?

I wouldn't mind seeing core handle a few basic blocks OOTB though like an image block for quick galleries, a table block etc. @jenlampton said we should just build them using content types and views, but I don't like that approach due to the overhead to make it work. 30+ min to create a gallery using a content type, views, configuration etc vs 25 seconds to upload 10 images and place the block done.

As usual I'm hijacking the topic with random ideas. Props @Olaf Grabienski for the request :blush:
